page.title: 14Event- Digwyddiad.
page.content: Friday,February 1st Lord Harlech was buried at Llanfihangel y Traethau, a small church in this community.He was involved in a fatal car accident near Oswestry on his way home. Amongst the mourners were Edward Kennedy and Jacqueline Onassis,his tenants,many villagers and others. Photographers, reporters and cameramen were there too to pay their last respects. He had been to University Colllege Oxford,became a Tory M.P.for Oswestry in 1950. He became Chairman of H.T.V. in 1963 and President of British Film Censors. During his lifetime he bore many crosses, losing his first wife in a car accident and his eldest son died in 1974. Amongst the land he owned was the famous home of Ellis Wynne-Y Las Ynys.
